https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.name: From Tokyo's heartbreak to historic triumphs in Paris - Manu Bhaker says 'let the past remain in the past'
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Indian shooter Manu Bhaker made history on Tuesday by becoming the first Indian to win two medals at the same Olympics post-Independence, securing her second bronze in the 10m air pistol mixed team event alongside Sarabjot Singh. This achievement comes after Bhaker had already secured a bronze medal in the women's 10m air pistol event, marking a significant milestone in her shooting career.Live Updates: Paris Olympics Day 4Bhaker, 22, had earlier faced disappointment due to a malfunction of her pistol during the Tokyo Olympics. She has now redeemed herself with stellar performances in Paris. 112131506Reflecting on her journey since Tokyo, Bhaker remarked, "After Tokyo, I was very disappointed, and how the events turned out to be for me were not very good. It took me a long time to overcome that. However, I came back stronger. So what is now is what matters. Let's just let the past remain in the past."— JioCinema (@JioCinema) Bhaker and Singh showcased a composed partnership to triumph in the 10m air pistol mixed team event, defeating the Korean duo of Lee Wonoho and Oh Yeh Jin with a score of 16-10. This victory brought India its second medal at Chateauroux's shooting range.In her previous event at the same venue, Bhaker secured a bronze medal in the women's 10m air pistol, eliminating the bitter memories of her Olympic debut in Tokyo 2020. 112132679Before Bhaker, British-Indian athlete Norman Pritchard had won two silver medals in the 200m sprint and 200m hurdles at the 1900 Olympics, a feat that occurred during the pre-Independence era.Sarabjot Singh also experienced a form of redemption after narrowly missing the men's 10m air pistol final, finishing ninth with a score of 577.Expressing her pride and gratitude after the match, Bhaker said, "I'm feeling really proud, and there is a lot of gratitude, thanks for all the blessings." 112132911Elaborating on their strategy, she added, "Actually we can't control what the rivals will do, we can do what is in our hand. Me and my partner thought, let's just try our best and we will keep fighting till the end."Sarabjot Singh, hailing from a farming family in Ambala, admitted to feeling immense pressure. "I'm feeling good, the game was very tough and there was a lot of pressure. I am very happy," said the 22-year-old.This historic achievement underscores Bhaker's resilience and marks a significant milestone for Indian sports, particularly women's sports in the country. Both young shooters have set a new benchmark, inspiring many with their determination and excellence.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleSummary: Manu Bhaker becomes first Indian to win two medals at the same Olympics post-Independence. Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh win bronze in the 10m air pistol mixed team event. This victory brought India its second medal at Chateauroux's shooting range.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: Kumari Selja âCM faceâ in Haryana Congress posters, rift with Hooda faction widens
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: CHANDIGARH: The rift between the Bhupinder Singh Hooda and SRB (Sirsa MP Selja, Rajya Sabha MP Randeep Surjewala, and former Union minister Birender Singh) factions of the Haryana Congress has widened after the Lok Sabha elections despite encouraging results, and the poster war for chief ministerial face has made it worse.112132441Seeing the senior Hooda and his son (Lok Sabha MP Deepender Hooda) hold workersâ meetings and run âHisab Doâ campaign with state Congress president Udai Bhan against the stateâs BJP govt, Sirsa MP Selja has intensified her Sandesh Yatra. While team Hooda refrains from commenting against her or her groupâs dissenting views, four of the five new MPs of the party from the state â Deepender Hooda, Jai Parkash, Satyapal Brahmchari, and Varun Choudhary â endorse the senior Hooda as their leader. Seljaâs group projects her as CM face in its meetings and has activated its teams in mobilising support for the Congress.Seljaâs team has now released a poster of SRBâs picture with the Congress high command that includes party president Malikkarjun Kharge, Lok Sabhaâs leader of opposition Rahul Gandhi, and former party president Sonia Gandhi. It has omitted the names of Hooda, partyâs political affairs in-charge for state Deepak Babaria, and Udai Bhan from this poster, but neither the state party leadership nor the AICC in-charge have spoken on it.Senior members of Seljaâs group claim the posterâs design and its projection of Selja as their personal choice. One of them said: âThe workers want her to occupy the top post, since a Congress victory is imminent in the assembly elections. We cannot question the workers.âHPCC president Udai Bhan dismissed the issue, saying: âIt doesnât matter. As long as she works for the party, promotes its symbol, and is loyal to the high command, the ultimate results will favour the Congress.â Selja, Surjwwala, and Birender Singh are Hooda familyâs main detractors in the state. The groupâs fourth member, Kiran Choudhry, quit the party last month.We also published the following articles recently Budget ignored Haryana, state will ignore BJP during polls: Deepender HoodaCongress MPs from Haryana protested in Parliament, accusing the government of neglecting their state in the Union Budget. Rohtak MP Deepender Hooda criticized Union minister Lalan Singh for dismissing their concerns, stating the people will similarly overlook the BJP in the upcoming Haryana assembly elections slated for October.112041350 MP Deepender Hooda will start the second phase of Haryana Mange Hisaab Abhiyan on 31st JulyDeepender Hooda, Lok Sabha MP from Rohtak, launched the second phase of Haryana Mange Hisaab Abhiyan on July 31, demanding accountability from the BJP government for its 10-year tenure. He plans to visit 56 assembly constituencies by August 30 to hold public meetings. Hooda's chargesheet includes questions on unemployment, inflation, corruption, and infrastructure failures.112086919 Union budget: Congress, Left parties to protest discrimination against some statesTamil Nadu Congress Committee planned protests across the state on Saturday, condemning the Centre's perceived discrimination in fund allocation highlighted in the Union budget. TNCC president K Selvaperunthagai stated that while Bihar and Andhra Pradesh received substantial amounts, Tamil Nadu received none despite generating significant GST revenue. Left parties also announced protests for similar grievances.112044551
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleSummary: TNCC president K Selvaperunthagai stated that while Bihar and Andhra Pradesh received substantial amounts, Tamil Nadu received none. Left parties also announced protests for similar grievances. Bhupinder Singh Hooda and SRB (Sirsa MP Selja, Rajya Sabha MP Randeep Surjewala, and former Union minister Birender Singh) factions of the Haryana Congress are at odds. Selja’s group projects her as CM face in its meetings and has activated its teams in mobilising support for the Congress.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.name: Who is Sarabjot Singh, India's latest Olympic medallist
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Ace shooter Sarabjot Singh, who 'gave up football to pursue shooting', won India's second medal with Manu Bhaker at Paris Olympics when the duo won the 10m Air Pistol Mixed Team event bronze medal match against Korea 16-10.At the shooting range in Chateauroux, the Indian team defeated the Korean team of Lee Wonoho and Oh Yeh Jin 16â10 to win the nation's second medal.Three days ago, Sarabjot, who had gone through a challenging time attempting to cope with the disappointment of losing the solo competition, said he felt a lot of pressure to do well.Sarabjot's first attempt for the Indians yielded a dismal 8.6, and Bhaker's shot of 10.2 resulted in an overall score of 18.8. With a total of 20.5, the Koreans won the first round and took a 2-0 lead.The team with the most pointsâ16âwins the medal in mixed team competitions.At a deficit of 0â2, Bhaker's reliability was evident, and Sarabjot benefited from it as they won the following four games to increase their lead to 8â2.Bhaker was so confident that during the entire 13-round competition, she only had three shots below ten.The Koreans faced an uphill battle as they gave in to pressure and lost 16â10, unable to equal their opponents.At 13 years of age, Sarabjot harboured hopes of becoming a footballer but while studying at Ambala's Bhagirath Public School, he saw a few kids wielding air guns at a makeshift range during a summer camp and went to his father and told him that he wants to pursue shooting.That was 2014. Sarbjot's father Jitender Singh, a farmer, told his son that the sport is pretty expensive. But eventually, after Sarabjot insisted for months, he agreed.It's a decision that the family will never repent, especially after what Sarabjot has achieved in the international circuit.— narendramodi (@narendramodi) Sarabjot has already won a senior ISSF World Cup gold in 10m air pistol.In the domestic circuit, his precision and calmness has made him the national champion twice.As of now, Sarabjot has won 2 World Championships gold medals, 3 World Cup gold medals, 1 ISSF Junior World Cup gold, 1 gold and 2 silver medals in ISSF Junior Cup and 2 gold medals, a sliver and a bronze in the Asian Championships.Sarabjot has always credited his coach Abhishek Rana for making a champion out of him.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleSummary: Sarabjot Singh won India's second medal with Manu Bhaker at Paris Olympics. The duo won the 10m Air Pistol Mixed Team event bronze medal match against Korea 16-10. At 13 years of age, Sarbjot harboured hopes of becoming a footballer.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.name: Techie loses Rs 28 lakh to dating scam; police reveals how he was trapped
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.articleBody: An engineering graduate in Visakhapatnam fell victim to a sophisticated online dating scam, losing over Rs 28 lakh. The victim, an unmarried mechanical engineer, was targeted by cyber crooks who created fake profiles on dating websites and apps to develop romantic relationships with unsuspecting individuals.How the techie was trappedInvestigations revealed that the engineer was ensnared by a well-orchestrated scam involving a fake online profile. The fraudsters, operating from Telangana, skillfully manipulated the victim's emotions, convincing him to transfer large sums of money under various pretexts. The police have identified one member of the gang, Kommagoni Lokesh, and are on the lookout for the other two accomplices.âThis dating scam is a new type of fraud where cyber crooks create fake profiles, featuring attractive women, on dating websites or apps to trap gullible men. Once a contact is established with the potential victims, the imposter engages in frequent and intimate communication to build trust and emotional connection with them,â Cybercrimes police station inspector K Bhavani Prasad, told TOI.âThereafter, the cybercrooks devise a fascinating story to seek money. Besides extorting money through fake narratives, the fraudsters also blackmail their victims by threatening to make public their personal information and compromising photos shared during the relationship. We have received complaints from some of the victims, who have lost good amounts of money in the fraud,â added Prasad. Tips to stay safe from online romance scamsScammers often create a sense of urgency to rush you into a committed relationship.Use reverse image search to confirm the authenticity of profile pictures. Be cautious about sharing personal information.Never send money to someone you've only met online, regardless of the reasonSet clear boundaries and avoid sharing sensitive information, such as your financial details or address.If something feels off, it probably is. End communication immediately if you suspect a scam.Stay informed about common romance scams and how to identify them.Be cautious of people who claim to be from overseas or unable to meet in personIf you decide to meet, choose a public place and inform a friend or family member of your plans.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.articleSummary: An engineering graduate in Visakhapatnam fell victim to a sophisticated online dating scam, losing over Rs 28 lakh. The victim, an unmarried mechanical engineer, was targeted by cyber crooks who created fake profiles on dating websites and apps to develop romantic relationships with unsuspecting individuals.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.name: Trailblazer Manu Bhaker first Indian to win two medals at same Olympics post-Independence
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Shooting sensation Manu Bhaker made more history on Tuesday, becoming the first Indian to win two medals in a single Olympics post-Independence. Manu, who had already made headlines by becoming the first woman shooter to win a medal with her bronze in the 10m air pistol individual event, added another bronze in the 10m air pistol mixed team event alongside Sarabjot Singh.Live Updates: Paris Olympics Day 4The duo triumphed over the Korean pair 16-10 in the bronze-medal match in Paris, securing India's second medal in the ongoing Summer Games. Manu can still make it a hat-trick of medals in Paris as she has the 25m Pistol event left to play, where she will participate alongside Esha Singh.This achievement marks a significant milestone in Indian sports history, with Manu setting multiple records. 112130992Records set by Manu Bhaker with her second bronze medalFirst Indian woman in 20 years, since Suma Shirur at the 2004 Athens Games, to enter an Olympic shooting final.First Indian woman shooter to win an Olympic medal.First Indian to win an Olympic medal in air pistol.First Indian to win two medals in the same edition of the Olympic Games post-Independence.First Indian shooter to win two Olympic medals.First Indian shooting pair (Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh) to win a team medal in the Olympics.First Indian to win Olympic medals in both individual and team events.Rare ParallelsManu Bhaker is now only the second Indian woman, after badminton great PV Sindhu, to win two Olympic medals.This series of accomplishments underscores Manu's exceptional talent and dedication, making her a standout athlete in Indian sports history. As she continues to shine on the global stage, Manu Bhaker's achievements will inspire future generations of Indian shooters.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleSummary: Shooting sensation Manu Bhaker becomes first Indian to win two medals in a single Olympics post-Independence. Bhaker added another bronze in the 10m air pistol mixed team event alongside Sarabjot Singh. The duo triumphed over the Korean pair 16-10 in the bronze-medal match in Paris.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: For SC-STs, funding IIT studies is tougher than cracking JEE
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: HYDERABAD: On August 1, when gates of IIT-Tirupati open, Bonila Aryan Roshan will be in queue of students heading to the chemical engineering department. Yet, Roshan is far from being ecstatic."I'm not sure if I'll be able to complete my four years of engineering," he says. Roshan, from SC community, belongs to Telangana's Siddipet district where his mother works as a daily wager for Rs 200 a day. The family has managed to raise Rs 50,000 to foot Roshan's IIT bills. "It will see me through my first semester... not sure how I will pay for my education after that," said the 18-year-old who secured a 2406 rank (SC category) in JEE 2024. He lost his father at a young age.Roshan's story is the reality of several students from Telangana's marginalised communities. IITs waive tuition fee of Rs 1 lakh for SC/ST candidates. But they are expected to bear other costs such as accommodation, mess, and registration. That comes to anywhere between Rs 1 lakh and Rs 1.5 lakh annually. The cash-strapped students end up selling whatever little assets they have, or they are left at the mercy of philanthropists.Over the past few weeks, TOI wrote about three such students - Badavath Madhulatha (IIT Patna), Vasam Sushmitha (IIT Gandhinagar) and Kuncham Shiva (IIT Mumbai). All were on the verge of giving up their IIT dream. When their stories went public, Telangana government, politicians, corporates and individuals came forward to support their education.Roshan hopes for a messiah too, as does Bhukya Dyandeep of Mulugu dist. The tribal boy has secured a seat at IIIT Ranchi after counselling. But he is struggling to raise Rs 1.56 lakh for fee.Vinodh Kumar, a well-wisher with the handle @vinodhkuma45637 posted on X: "They are from a very poor family. His father died 13 years ago, and his mother is working in a private school as an attendant. They are waiting for help."Vishnu (name changed), son of small-time farmers from Khammam, shares the tumultuous time his family had to endure after he got a seat at IIT Kharagpur three years ago. "From selling our cattle to borrowing money, we exhausted all options to arrange Rs 1.3 lakh per year. It was in my third year that I managed to find a sponsor and study without the fear of having to drop out," said the final-year B Tech student.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleSummary: IITs waive tuition fee of Rs 1 lakh for SC/ST candidates. But they are expected to bear other costs such as accommodation, mess, and registration. The cash-strapped students end up selling whatever little assets they have.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.name: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gatesâ son-in-law to compete in Paris Olympics 2024: Hereâs the country he will represent and more
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.articleBody: Nayel Nassar, the husband of tech billionaire Bill Gates' eldest daughter Jennifer, is set to represent Egypt in the equestrian jumping event at the Paris Olympics. The Egyptian-American equestrian has previously competed in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, achieving 16th and 24th positions in the team and individual events, respectively. Nassar's participation in the Paris Olympics comes as his wife, Jennifer Gates, prepares to welcome their second child. The couple married in 2021 and welcomed their first child in 2023.Nassar began his equestrian career at a young age, participating in international competitions since his teens. His inclusion in the Egyptian Olympic team highlights the growing influence of equestrian sports in the country.Melinda Gates, Jennifer's mother, has expressed her support for Nassar on social media, wishing him success in the upcoming Olympics. In an Instagram post, the philanthropist shared Nassar's photo and wrote: âSo excited to watch you compete at the Olympics, @nayelnassar! Iâm rooting for you.â The Gates family has been in the public eye following the high-profile divorce of Bill and Melinda Gates in 2022. Despite the separation, the former couple continues to co-parent their three children.Nayel Nassarâs Olympics participation faces criticismAccording to a report by EssentiallySports, Nassar's participation has been overshadowed by controversy surrounding the size of his support team. A ten-person delegation accompanying the athlete to Paris has sparked public outrage, with many questioning the necessity of such a large entourage at public expense. While the Egyptian Equestrian Federation has denied any financial support for Nassar or his team, claiming they covered all expenses, the controversy continues to simmer.Despite the off-field drama, Nassar remains focused on his performance in the equestrian competition. A seasoned athlete with previous Olympic experience, he aims to clinch his first Olympic medal in Paris.  Nassar's journey to the Olympics has been marked by significant achievements, including a bronze medal at the Winter Equestrian Festival and a victory at the CSIO4*-W Nations Cup of Rabat.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.articleSummary: Nayel Nassar is set to represent Egypt in the equestrian jumping event at the Paris Olympics. The Egyptian-American has previously competed in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, achieving 16th and 24th positions in the team and individual events, respectively. Nassar's participation has been overshadowed by controversy surrounding the size of his support team.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: At 36Â°C, âcold desertâ Leh too hot for flights; 12 cancelled in 3 days
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: Mumbai/New Delhi: The cold desert is getting too hot for flights to operate, in perhaps the most stark sign of global warming. Since Saturday, flight operations at Leh, Indiaâs highest commercial airport, have been affected as IndiGo and SpiceJet have been forced to cancel a dozen flights scheduled around noon as day-time temperatures soared to 36 degrees Celsius, rendering the high-altitude air too thin for safe aircraft operations.âThis is probably the first time that airline flights have been cancelled because of high temperatures. Last year, the temperature was not so high as to affect flights,â said an official from Leh airport, requesting anonymity. He added that most of the flights cancelled since Saturday were Delhi-bound. 112119449 Leh sees some 15-16 aircraft arrivals and as many departures daily. Saturday saw two flight cancellations, followed by four on Sunday with as many as six cancelled on Monday.We also published the following articles recently Air Canada flight cancelled due to flight attendant's 'inappropriate behaviour'A Montreal-bound Air Canada flight from Morocco was canceled after a flight attendant was recorded yelling at a passenger. Passengers were delayed until Sunday and offered compensation. The airline issued an apology and is reviewing the incident. The flight was initially set to depart on Friday but had to return to the gate due to the conflict.112115126 Beirut airport cancels flights amid fears of Israeli attack; airlines cite 'insurance risks'Several flights at Beirut airport were cancelled or delayed due to increasing tensions between Israel and Hezbollah after a deadly rocket strike in Golan Heights. Insurance risks prompted airlines, including Lufthansa and Turkish Airlines, to suspend flights. The escalating conflict has affected travel and shipping in the region.112094937 83-year-old missing since CrowdStrike outage caused flight cancellation, police launch searchAn 83-year-old man, Patrick A Bailey, has been missing for a week after his flight was canceled at Orlando International Airport due to a CrowdStrike outage. Bailey left his cellphone at a hotel, making contact difficult. His son and the Orlando Police Department urge anyone with information on his whereabouts to come forward.112090001

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.name: 'India is incredibly delighted': PM Modi congratulates Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh on Paris Olympic bronze
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday congratulated Indian shooters Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh for winning the bronze medal in the 10m mixed team event at the Paris Olympics. PM Modi expressed his pride and delight in the duo's success, highlighting their skills and dedication.Live Updates: Paris Olympics Day 4In a message on X, PM Modi stated, "Our shooters continue to make us proud! Congratulations to Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh for winning the Bronze medal in the 10m Air Pistol Mixed Team event at the Olympics. Both of them have shown great skills and teamwork. India is incredibly delighted."He further praised Bhaker for her consistent accomplishments. "For Manu, this is her second consecutive Olympic medal, showcasing her consistent excellence and dedication," Modi added.— narendramodi (@narendramodi) The Indian pair demonstrated exceptional composure and skill, defeating the South Korean team 16-10 to secure the bronze medal. This victory not only earned India its second medal at the ongoing Summer Games but also marked a historic milestone for Bhaker. She became the first Indian post-Independence to win two medals in a single edition of the Olympics. 112131506Earlier, Bhaker had clinched a bronze medal in the women's 10m air pistol event at the same venue, reinforcing her status as one of India's premier shooters. The synergy between Bhaker and Singh was evident throughout the competition, with Bhaker's composed performance complemented by Singh's supportive role.The Indian shooting contingent has impressed on the global stage, with Bhaker and Singh's victory serving as a testament to their hard work and dedication.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleSummary: PM Narendra Modi congratulated Indian shooters Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh. PM Modi expressed his pride and delight in the duo's success, highlighting their skills and dedication. The Indian pair defeated the South Korean team 16-10 to secure the bronze medal.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.name: CoinDCX co-founder slams rival cryptocurrency exchange WazirX's '55/45 plan': Hate to be saying this ...
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.articleBody: CoinDCX, one of the biggest rivals of crypto currency platform, WazirX seems not in sync with the '55/45 approach' that the platform has announced to deal with the hacking attack that saw almost half of its reserves getting stolen. On July 19, WazirX experienced a significant security breach, resulting in the loss of over $230 million worth of cryptocurrency assets. In response, WazirX announced on Saturday a controversial solution: distributing the loss among all customers. In a blog post last week, WazirX said that it is navigating the situation with transparency and fairness. "This approach aims to distribute the financial impact across all users equitably. Unlike traditional recovery methods that can take years, this strategy offers a faster, more flexible solution by allowing immediate access to a significant portion of assets while maintaining the possibility of further recovery for those who choose to wait" WazirX stated in the post. CoinDCX co-founder slams WazirX's approachSumit Gupta, cofounder of CoinDCX, expressed his concerns on X, formerly Twitter, urging WazirX to rethink its approach to managing the situation. "Hate to be saying this, but the way @WazirXIndia is handling this entire situation isn't community first and this IMO won't go down well for them. This sadly is also hurting the other ecosystem participants. The first contribution to losses should ALWAYS come from the Company (i.e. WazirX in this case) and the treasury and assets the company holds. I have not seen any such commitment around this from the company side, instead making customers directly absorb the 45% losses is utter nonsense. The poll options are also framed in a manner to protect the business first and not the customers. Hopefully they will reconsider their approach and do what's right by the customers," wrote Gupta. He warned further that "the incident could also negatively impact participation in the broader crypto ecosystem."WazirX's controversial solution to security hackWazirX's socialized loss strategy has not gone well with users on the platform. The cryptocurrency exchange is facing a huge backlash from social media users on its approach to deal with the hacking. Several users wrote that the company failed with the security and now wants the customer to pay the price.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech.articleSummary: WazirX experienced a security breach on July 19, resulting in the loss of over $230 million worth of cryptocurrency assets. The platform announced on Saturday a controversial solution: distributing the loss among all customers. CoinDCX, one of the biggest rivals of crypto currency platform, is not in sync with the '55/45 approach'

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.name: 'Nightmares every week, is this governance?' Oppn targets govt over series of rail accidents
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleBody: NEW DELHI: The opposition parties, including Congress, Samajwadi Party, and Trinamool Congress, criticized the BJP-led central government on Tuesday for the recent spate of railway accidents, accusing the railway ministry of lacking accountability.In the early hours of Tuesday, at least 18 coaches of the Howrah-Mumbai Mail derailed near Barabamboo in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district, resulting in the death of two persons and injuries to 20 others. The accident occurred at 3.45am, approximately 80 km from Jamshedpur, under the jurisdiction of the South Eastern Railway's Chakradharpur Division.PR machine of the 'Fail Minister' continues: CongressThe Congress party slammed railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and reffered to him as the "fail minister" Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh said in a post on X, "Yet another railway accident. But the PR machine of the Fail Minister continues.""In June and July 2024 alone, the Fail Minister has overseen three accidents that have cumulatively cost 17 Indians their lives and left 100s injured," he said, hitting out at Vaishnaw.Congress leader Pawan Khera highlighted the frequency of train accidents in Modi's New India, referring to them as "a weekly reality.""July 18: Train accident in Gonda, UP: Chandigarh-Dibrugarh Express: 4 killed, 31 injured. July 19: Goods train derailed in Valsad, Gujarat. July 20: 12 wagons of a freight train derailed in Amroha, UP. July 21: 3 wagons of a goods train derailed in Alwar, Rajasthan. July 21: Goods train derailed in Ranaghat, West Bengal. July 26: Goods train derailed at Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Orissa. July 29: Bihar Sampark Kranti Express detached from other coaches in Samastipur, Bihar. July 30: Several coaches of the Howrah-CSMT Express train derailed in Chakradharpur, Jharkhand: 2 killed, 20 injured," he said.— INCIndia (@INCIndia) Nightmares every week, says Bengal CM Mamata BanerjeeWest Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee expressed her concern over the "disastrous" Howrah-Mumbai Mail train accident and questioned the central government's governance. "I seriously ask: is this governance? This series of nightmares almost every week, this unending procession of deaths and injuries on railway tracks: for how long shall we tolerate this? Will there be no end to the callousness of Government of India?!" Banerjee said."My heart goes out to the bereaved families, condolences to the next of kin," she said.People thank God when a day passes without any train accident: RJD MP Manoj JhaRJD MP Manoj Jha pointed out the irony of people thanking God when a day passes without any train accidents. He questioned the progress of the 'Kavach' safety system, which was prominently mentioned in the previous Budget but was not even discussed this time. "People thank God when a day passes without any train accident. Tall claims were made regarding 'Kavach' in the last Budget. This time, it was not even mentioned. I would like to ask how much distance has been covered under 'Kavach' cover or was that just for media management? I think Government is not bothered even after such accidents," Jha said.'Seems that government wants to make a record in every field': Akhilesh YadavSamajwadi Party MP Akhilesh Yadav questioned the effectiveness of the government's safety and security claims and the allocation of a substantial Budget in light of the recurring accidents."It seems that the government wants to make a record in every field. A record is also going to be made of the number of paper leaks. Despite the govt's claims of safety and security and a big budget, why are accidents happening?...Some time ago, India participated in COP29 & G20 was also held...Uttarakhand has also seen landslides. The government should tell what it is doing to tackle such incidents," Akhilesh said. Minister for Railways has some 'Kavach' for sure, says Aaditya ThackerayShiv Sena UBT leader Aaditya Thackeray questioned the lack of action taken against the railway minister, despite the recurring incidents."I donât know about the trains, but the minister for Railways has some âKavachâ for sure, because of which he hasnât been sacked even after so many rail accidents in his tenure. Every week we see some accidents, and thereâs no action taken. Instead, the Minister has been made the âpolitical in- chargeâ of bjp Maharashtra for the elections. Shouldnât he be focusing on the Ministry?" Shiv Aaditya Thackeray said in a post on X.The Howrah-Mumbai Mail derailment is the latest in a series of rail accidents that have occurred in the past year, with the most recent major incident being the Kanchenjunga Express derailment in Darjeeling, West Bengal, in June 2024, which claimed the lives of more than 15 people and left dozens injured.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleSummary: The Howrah-Mumbai Mail derailment is the latest in a series of rail accidents that have occurred in the past year. Shiv Sena UBT leader Aaditya Thackeray questioned the lack of action taken against the railway minister. 18 coaches of the Howrah-Mumbai Mail derailed near Barabamboo in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district, resulting in the death of two persons. The accident occurred at 3.45am, approximately 80 km from Jamshedpur, under the jurisdiction of the South Eastern Railway's Chakradharpur Division.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.name: 'With all due respect, don't be a bi**h': Startup founder shares horrors of hiring
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Founder of Grump start-up Senain Sawant shared the horrors of hiring she recently faced after being called a "bi**h" by an applicant during an interview. Posting the screenshots of the chat, Sawant said, "The younger generation is in clear need of strong guidance, and as a young entrepreneur myself, I am appalled by the audacity of this candidate to think it is okay to call the company founder, or anyone in a hiring position for that matter, a Bi***"Sawant had scheduled a video interview with the applicant which, due to some technical reasons at the latter's fault, couldn't work out. "They joined the call with the camera off, said they don't own a computer and something about ios update not allowing video calls. I responded with, 'how do you usually work?', to which they replied 'My previous company gave us a laptop, but if one is needed, I can arrange," she wrote in a Linkedin post.Observing that their "tone was off from the start", Sawant said, "I asked them to join at a time when their video can be turned on, since this an interview and I need to see who I'm speaking with. They said "Fine" and cut the call. Their tone was off from the start, they weren't audible to begin with and it seemed like they were out in public from the amount of noise in the background."
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleSummary: Sawant had scheduled a video interview with the applicant which, due to some technical reasons at the latter's fault, couldn't work out. Posting the screenshots of the chat, Sawant said, "The younger generation is in clear need of strong guidance"

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.name: Paris Olympics: Another Olympic medal for Manu Bhaker as she wins 10m Air Pistol Mixed Team event bronze-medal match with Sarabjot Singh
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleBody: NEW DELHI: With her confidence sky high after breaking shooting's Olympic medal drought following a long three-year wait, Manu Bhaker didn't let her fans down as she, along with Sarabjot Singh, won the bronze-medal match in the 10m air pistol team event at the shooting range at Chateauroux on Tuesday.Manu and Sarabjot took on Korea in the battle for third place on Tuesday and the Indian duo won the match by 16 points to 10.At the shooting range in Chateauroux, the Indian team defeated the Korean team of Lee Wonoho and Oh Yeh Jin 16â10 to win the nation's second medal.The 22-year-old Manu is the first Indian to win two medals at the same Olympics (post Independence).Manu had earlier bagged the bronze medal in the women's 10m air pistol event at the same venue.In the pre-Independence era, British-Indian athlete Norman Pritchard had won two silver medals in 200m sprint and 200m hurdles at the 1900 Olympics."I'm feeling really proud and there is a lot of gratitude, thanks for all the blessings" said Bhaker after the match, which the two young Indians played with remarkable poise to make it a one-sided contest."Actually we can't control (what the rivals will do), we can do what is in our hand, me and my partner thought let's just try our best and we will keep fighting till the end," added the shooter from Jhajjar in Haryana. — narendramodi (@narendramodi) Three days ago, Sarabjot, who had gone through a challenging time attempting to cope with the disappointment of losing the solo competition, said he felt a lot of pressure to do well."I'm feeling good, the game was very tough and there was a lot of pressure, I am very happy," said the 22-year-old Sarabjot, who comes from a farming family.Sarabjot's first attempt for the Indians yielded a dismal 8.6, and Bhaker's shot of 10.2 resulted in an overall score of 18.8. With a total of 20.5, the Koreans won the first round and took a 2-0 lead.The team with the most pointsâ16âwins the medal in mixed team competitions.At a deficit of 0â2, Bhaker's reliability was evident, and Sarabjot benefited from it as they won the following four games to increase their lead to 8â2.Bhaker was so confident that during the entire 13-round competition, she only had three shots below ten.The Koreans faced an uphill battle as they gave in to pressure and lost 16â10, unable to equal their opponents.On Monday, Manu and Sarabjot tallied 580 points as India finished third, just a point behind Serbia, who entered the gold medal match against Turkiye. Korea bagged the last spot in the medal round with 579 points, pushing the Chinese second team to fifth place.The second Indian team in the fray - Rhythm Sangwan and Arjun Singh Cheema - had finished in 10th spot with a total of 576 points on Monday.— WeAreTeamIndia (@WeAreTeamIndia)
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleSummary: Manu Bhaker is the first Indian to win two medals at the same Olympics (post Independence) Bhaker, along with Sarabjot Singh, won the bronze-medal match in the 10m air pistol team event. The Indian team defeated the Korean team of Lee Wonoho and Oh Yeh Jin 16â10.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: To 'curb love jihad', UP proposes life imprisonment for accused
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: LUCKNOW: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly is set to consider and potentially pass a bill on Tuesday that aims to amend the Unlawful Conversion of Religion Act, increasing the maximum punishment to life imprisonment and a fine of Rs 5 lakh for violators. The amendment targets anyone who threatens, attacks, marries, promises to marry, conspires, or traffics a woman, minor, or any person with the intention of conversion, categorizing these actions as severe crimes.The proposed amendment, named the Uttar Pradesh Prohibition of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Bill, 2024, stipulates penalties of 20 years to life imprisonment for such offenses. Previously, the maximum punishment was 10 years and a fine of Rs 50,000.Parliamentary Affairs Minister Suresh Khanna introduced the bill in the House on Monday. The amended provisions allow any person to register an FIR in conversion cases, expanding the scope from the previous requirement where the victim, their parents, or siblings needed to lodge the complaint. Now, anyone can inform the police about such cases in writing.âThese cases will not be heard by any court below sessions court,â states the amended bill. Additionally, it highlights that bail pleas will not be considered without giving an opportunity to the public prosecutor, and all offenses under this act will be non-bailable.Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath initiated this bill as part of efforts to curb what is termed "love jihad," referring to alleged forcible conversion under the guise of marriage. An ordinance was first issued in November 2020, and after the bill was passed by both houses of the Uttar Pradesh Legislature, the Uttar Pradesh Prohibition of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Act, 2021 came into effect.This forthcoming legislative session will be crucial as it deliberates on these significant amendments aimed at deterring unlawful religious conversions, potentially leading to stricter legal repercussions for offenders.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleSummary: The amendment targets anyone who threatens, attacks, marries, promises to marry, conspires, or traffics a woman, minor, or any person with the intention of conversion. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath initiated this bill as part of efforts to curb what is termed "love jihad"

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: A319 Faridabad 'flight' gets stranded on busy Kolkata stretch
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: KOLKATA: The sight of a 110-ft aircraft on a tractor trailer stuck on a busy road near Dakshineswar left motorists and locals amused. Many stopped to take photographs and selfies with the scrapped plane as traffic was hit on both flanks of the road on Monday.The scrapped Airbus A319 that was being transported from Kolkata airport to Faridabad in Haryana on a tractor trailer was the last of the consignment of five planes which had been retired. It had been purchased by Delhi-based firm Moni Ji Enterprises and was being ferried to north India. 112124248 The company buys scrap planes and turns them into restaurants, film shooting sets, installations at city landmarks, amusement parks and innovative office cabins.In the early hours of Monday, the tractor trailer with the plane fuselage on its deck was stopped at the entry point to the Vivekananda Setu next to Dakshineswar temple by traffic cops after the driver missed the diversion to take Nivedita Setu. While it was reversing, the trailer suffered a snag and got stranded. Following daylong deliberation with cops and attempts to repair the trailer, it was finally up for journey again by late on Monday evening.TOI had earlier written how another scrapped aircraft got stranded during the transportation to Amritsar â 2,000 kilometres away â in March. It got stuck on the road that PM Narendra Modi was scheduled to take at that time. Two other aircraft had made it to Delhi without a problem. The agency uses trailer trucks with lower ground clearance to avoid the unusual cargo getting stuck under bridges and height barriers. Earlier this month, the fourth aircraft, too, was transported out of the airport.âThis particular plane is set to be turned into a restaurant. After the initial fiasco with long trailers, we had brought in new trailers this time to ensure such instances donât happen again. We also had the necessary permissions from NHAI but then there was some misunderstanding and the trailer got stuck. However, the situation has been sorted and the trailer is on the move,â said Ramkesh Sharma of Shree Shyam Lifters from Vadodara, who had been facilitating the logistics.Of the nine Airbus A319 aircraft stationed in Kolkata, five have been retired.âAll five scrapped Air India planes have left the airport premises. There are three more retired aircraft â two belonging to Alliance Air and another 9-seater plane belonging to Dylan Aviation School â which are still parked on airport premises. We have asked the airline authorities to remove them from the airport at the earliest,â said Pravat Ranjan Beuria, the Kolkata airport director.The aircraft on the stationary trailer became a worry for Barrackpore cops as the unusual cargo turned into a selfie zone for locals and motorists.TOI was at the spot near Daksineshwar college where the trailer and the aircraft were kept on Monday and found a large number of curious onlookers at the spot. âItâs not everyday that you get to see an aircraft parked on the roadside. How could we miss such a moment?â said Priti Chakraborty, who was spotted taking photos with the aircraft on her way to office at Sector V.Suman Das on a motorbike and Bibha Jha on board a bus were also found taking photos of the parked aircraft.âI have never boarded an aircraft and this is the first time I am seeing one from such a close distance,â said Jha, who works at a private firm near Lalbazar and had got off the bus in excitement.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleSummary: Suman Das on a motorbike and Bibha Jha on board a bus were also found taking photos of the parked aircraft. “I have never boarded an aircraft and this is the first time I am seeing one from such a close distance,â said Jha. Airbus A319 was being transported from Kolkata airport to Faridabad in Haryana. It was the last of the consignment of five planes which had been retired. It had been purchased by Delhi-based firm Moni Ji Enterprises and was being ferried to north India.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: Delhi IAS coaching centre deaths: SUV driver asks 'why I am being blamed? I was driving at 15kmph, other cars passed before and after'
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Manoj Kathuria, the driver of a sports utility vehicle, told a Delhi court on Monday that he had no knowledge of the students' presence or the intention to cause their deaths. Kathuria is believed to have sped past the streets in Old Rajender Nagar on Saturday, causing a wave of accumulated rainwater to push down the gates of a three-storey building and flooding the basement, which resulted in the death of three coaching centre students.The court of Vinod Kumar, judicial magistrate first class, sent five of the individuals arrested in the case to 14 days in judicial custody till August 12. The court will hear their bail pleas on Tuesday.âThe 30-feet-wide road was open. There was 2.5 feet of accumulated water and my speed was just 15kmph. I was driving in the centre of the road,â Kathuria told the court through his counsel. âCommon people have been arrested to please the media and show the students that something was being done. But no govt officers have been arrested. Intent and knowledge are prerequisites for the offence. How would I know that students were present in the basement?âKathuria also said through his counsel that while driving his SUV, there was no way he would have anticipated that there was a library in the basement with students present and that water would enter the basement. âOther cars went before me and many others came after me. Why did the water not reach other houses? The fault lies with the institutes and departments. Why were officials of Delhi Jal Board not arrested?â he asked.The counsel requested bail for Kathuria, following which the court asked him to file the written submissions on the matter.Kathuria was among the five who had been arrested. The counsel for the four co-owners of the coaching centre's basement â Tejinder Singh, Parvinder Singh, Harvinder Singh and Sarabjeet Singh â told the court that leasing out a building did not fix any liability for an alleged offence, including causing death by negligence and culpable homicide not amounting to murder, on them.The counsel argued that the offences under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhitaâs sections 102 (culpable homicide by causing the death of a person other than the person whose death was intended), 105 (culpable homicide not amounting to murder) and 106 (causing death by negligence) werenât applicable to his clients. He contended that these sections were invoked to bypass the 2014 Arnesh Kumar judgment guidelines of the Supreme Court on arrest. âThe safety of the building was the sole responsibility of the lessee,â he added.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleSummary: Manoj Kathuria told a Delhi court on Monday that he had no knowledge of the students' presence or the intention to cause their deaths. Kathuria is believed to have sped past the streets in Old Rajender Nagar on Saturday, causing a wave of accumulated rainwater to push down the gates of a three-storey building. The court of Vinod Kumar sent five of the individuals arrested in the case to 14 days in judicial custody till August 12.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.name: Babus skipping Independence-Day event may face action
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Cabinet secretary Rajiv Gauba has written to all secretaries to ensure all invited officials of respective ministries attend the Independence Day celebration at Red Fort "without fail". The letter says that "serious view" will be taken for being absent. Referring to officials skipping the celebration in the past, Gauba said that though officers invited were expected to be present, "it has been observed that some do not turn up. This, to say the least, is inappropriate. There is, clearly, a need to remind officers that it is their duty to attend the Independence Day ceremony." He directed secretaries to suitably advise all officers. "You may also like to inform them that a serious view would be taken of their absence on this occasion," Gauba added. Officials admitted that many who get invitations don't turn up for th event. "This time an advisory has been issued well in advance to sensitise everyone to follow the instruction. Officials should take pride in attending the national event," said an official.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleSummary: Cabinet secretary Rajiv Gauba has written to all secretaries to ensure all invited officials of respective ministries attend the Independence Day celebration at Red Fort. Officials admitted that many who get invitations don't turn up for th event.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.name: Budget 2024 three times UPA's last Budget in 2014: PM Narendra Modi at CII post-Budget conference
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleBody: Budget 2024: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday addressed a CII post-Budget 2024 conference, stating that in 10 years, his government has tripled Indiaâs Budget. The last Budget presented by the Manmohan Singh government in 2014 was of Rs 16 lakh crore. Ten years later, the Union Budget 2024 presented by us a few days ago is Rs 48 lakh crore, which is three times, Modi said.Modi also said that the capital expenditure allocation under his governments has grown manifold. "Capital expenditure is called the biggest productive medium of resource investment," he said at the âJourney Towards Viksit Bharat: A Post Union Budget 2024-25' conference. In 2004, the capex allocation of UPAâs first Budget was Rs 90,000 crore. This increased to only Rs 2 lakh crore in the last UPA budget in 2014, Modi said. At present the capex allocation is over Rs 11 lakh crore, Modi added. Modi pointed out that the capex allocation of railways and highways has become 8 times under his government.PM Modi said that India, which is currently the worldâs fifth largest economy, will soon become the third largest. He also noted the time when India had been ranked among the âFragile Fiveâ economies in the world. Modi said that his governments have progressively helped India move from a state of vulnerability to a place of strength.PM Modi also said that in a world where most economies are struggling with low growth and high inflation, India stands out as an economy which is seeing high economic growth and low inflation. He also said that India's fiscal prudence has become an example for the world to see.Modi spoke of the government's initiatives to transform the manufacturing sector of the economy with steps like 'Make in India', Production Linked Incentive (PLI) schemes, liberalisation of FDI norms, setting up of multi-modal logistics hubs.Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the first Union Budget of the newly elected NDA government on July 23, 2024.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleSummary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a CII post-Budget 2024 conference. He said that in 10 years, his government has tripled Indiaâs Budget. The last Budget presented by the Manmohan Singh government was of Rs 16 lakh crore.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.name: Watch: Vande Bharat Passenger goes berserk after served non-veg by 'mistake'; slaps waiter
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleBody: NEW DELHI: A video of an altercation between a passenger and pantry staff has gone viral on social media after the passenger, who was a vegetarian was mistakenly served non-vegetarian food. The event snowballed into chaos after the agitated passenger "gave two tight slaps" to the waiter upon finding out it was non-veg that he had consumed. Kunal Verma, a fellow passenger who recorded the entire incident on July 26, said in his post on X that the elderly passenger in the Vande Bharat train consumed the food parcel without taking note of the label in the parcel. — itsmekunal07 (@itsmekunal07) However, the elderly passenger's action irked co-passengers, who immediately objected to his actions. In the video, the passenger questions, âWhere is it mentioned?â possibly referring to the lack of a non-vegetarian symbol on the food parcel.A fellow passenger reprimands him, saying, âWhy would you slap him? Look at your age.â The waiter is seen apologizing, while other passengers demand an apology from the elderly man, with several condemning his action and expressing shock at his treatment of the waiter.In a separate video, the elderly passenger is seen arguing with another co-passenger, who tells him, âYou should be ashamed of yourself,â criticising him as âoversmart.âThis incident follows another from January, where a video of two passengers arguing over luggage space on a Vande Bharat Express went viral, showing the two men shouting at each other until a railway officer intervened to defuse the situation.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleSummary: A video of an altercation between a passenger and pantry staff has gone viral on social media. The passenger, who was a vegetarian was mistakenly served non-vegetarian food. The event snowballed into chaos after the agitated passenger "gave two tight slaps" to the waiter.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/worl.name: Pakistan beggar found unconscious with over PKR 5 lakh, Saudi passport in pocket
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/worl.articleBody: NEW DELHI: An elderly beggar was found unconscious on Khushab Road in Pakistan Punjab's Sargodha district by the Rescue 1122 team, with over Rs 0.5 million (1,60,544 INR) in his pocket. The man was carrying PKR 534,000 and a passport indicating multiple trips to Saudi Arabia. Upon discharge from the hospital, he retrieved his money and belongings, according to Geo News. Residents in the area informed the rescue team that this man had been begging regularly in the same vicinity.In September last year, concerns had been raised about Pakistani nationals exploiting Umrah visas for begging in Saudi Arabia. According to The News report, the ministry of overseas Pakistanis and Human Resource Development reported this issue to the Senate Committee on Overseas Pakistanis.At a standing committee meeting, the secretary of the ministry of overseas Pakistanis stated that 90% of beggars detained in foreign countries were Pakistanis. "The Iraqi and Saudi ambassadors have reported that their jails were overcrowded due to these arrests,â he told the senate committee. âMost of the pickpockets caught inside the Masjid Al Haram in Saudi Arabia were of Pakistani origin, and they exploited the Umrah visas for begging purposes."
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/worl.articleSummary: An elderly beggar was found unconscious on Khushab Road in Pakistan Punjab's Sargodha district. The man was carrying PKR 534,000 and a passport indicating multiple trips to Saudi Arabia. Residents in the area informed the rescue team that this man had been begging regularly in the same vicinity.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.name: August 2024 Bank Holidays: Banks closed up to 13 days - check full list of state-wise bank holidays
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleBody: August 2024 Bank Holidays: In August, banks across India, both public and private, will be closed for up to 13 days, including Sundays, national and regional holidays, and the second and fourth Saturdays of the month.Various festivals will be celebrated in different states during August, leading to bank closures. These include Ker Puja, Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Patriot's Day, Independence Day/Parsi New Year (Shahenshahi), Raksha Bandhan, Janmashtami. The specific dates and states affected by these closures vary.August 2024: Full List of Bank HolidaysAugust 3 (Saturday) - Ker Puja: Banks closed in Agartala.August 8 (Thursday) - Tendong Lho Rum Faat: Banks closed in Sikkim.August 13 (Tuesday) - Patriotâs Day: Banks closed in Manipur.August 15 (Thursday) - Independence Day/Parsi New Year (Shahenshahi): All banks in India closed.August 19 (Monday) - Raksha Bandhan/Jhulana Purnima/Birthday of Bir Bikram Kishore Manikya Bahadur: Banks closed in Tripura, Gujarat, Odisha, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, and Himachal Pradesh.August 20 (Tuesday) - Sree Narayana Guru Jayanthi: Banks closed in Kerala.August 26 (Monday) - Janmashtami (Shravan Vad-8)/Krishna Jayanthi: Banks closed in Gujarat, Odisha, Chandigarh, Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Rajasthan, Jammu, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Meghalaya, Himachal Pradesh, and Srinagar.Aug-24381315192026Agartalaâ¢â¢â¢Ahmedabadâ¢â¢â¢Aizawlâ¢Belapurâ¢Bengaluruâ¢Bhopalâ¢Bhubaneswarâ¢â¢â¢Chandigarhâ¢â¢Chennaiâ¢â¢Dehradunâ¢â¢â¢Gangtokâ¢â¢â¢Guwahatiâ¢Hyderabad - Andhra Pradeshâ¢â¢Hyderabad - Telanganaâ¢â¢Imphalâ¢â¢Itanagarâ¢Jaipurâ¢â¢â¢Jammuâ¢â¢Kanpurâ¢â¢â¢Kochiâ¢â¢Kohimaâ¢Kolkataâ¢â¢Lucknowâ¢â¢â¢Mumbaiâ¢Nagpurâ¢New Delhiâ¢Panajiâ¢Patnaâ¢â¢Raipurâ¢â¢Ranchiâ¢â¢Shillongâ¢â¢Shimlaâ¢â¢â¢Srinagarâ¢â¢Thiruvananthapuramâ¢â¢This year, August 15, which is Independence Day, falls on a Thursday, so there will not be an extended weekend during that week.However, in certain states, there will be a long weekend due to the closure of banks on Monday, August 26, for Janmashtami (Shravan Vad-8)/Krishna Jayanthi, which follows the fourth Saturday and Sunday of the month. According to an ET report, the states affected by this long weekend include Gujarat, Orissa, Chandigarh, Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Rajasthan, Jammu, Uttar Pradesh, Bengal, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Meghalaya, Himachal Pradesh, and Srinagar.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleSummary: In August 2024, banks across India will be closed for up to 13 days. This includes Sundays, national and regional holidays, and the second and fourth Saturdays of the month. These include Ker Puja, Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Patriot's Day, Independence Day/Parsi New Year, Raksha Bandhan, Janmashtami.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.name: In PM Modi's 'Amritkaal' empty pockets of common citizens also being extracted: Rahul Gandhi
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleBody: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday targeted the Centre over substantial penalties collected by public sector banks from customers who failed to maintain the required average monthly balance.In a post on X, Rahul aserted that this "penalty system" is a part of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's elaborate scheme, likening it to a "chakravyuh," an inescapable trap, designed to burden the average Indian citizen. "In the Amritkaal of Narendra Modi, the 'empty pockets' of common Indians are also being extracted. The government that waived off Rs 16 lakh crore of its industrialists has collected Rs 8,500 crore from poor Indians who are unable to maintain even the minimum balance," Rahul Gandhi said.— RahulGandhi (@RahulGandhi) "The penalty system is the door of Modi's Chakravyuh through which an attempt is being made to break the back of the common Indian. But remember, the people of India are not Abhimanyu, they are Arjun, they know how to answer your every atrocity by breaking the Chakravyuh," he added.Rahul's criticism followed a written reply in the Lok Sabha, which revealed that public sector banks collected around Rs 8,500 crore in penalties for not maintaining the average monthly minimum balance over five years starting from FY 2019-20. Pankaj Chaudhary, the minister of state in the finance ministry, also informed the Lok Sabha on Monday that state-run banks have charged depositors Rs 2,331 crore in penalties for the same reason in FY24.Rahul's comments come a day after he accused the NDA government in the Lok Sabha of trapping farmers, youth, soldiers, backward classes, and MSMEs in a vicious "chakravyuh" under Modi's regime. He expressed disappointment that the finance minister did not address farmers' demands for a legal guarantee on MSP and the caste census clamor.On Monday, Rahul used the "chakravyuh" theme, suggesting that the mythological episode from Kurukshetra was being re-enacted in the 21st century by a "trap" controlled by the PM, home minister, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, Gautam Adani, Mukesh Ambani, and NSA Ajit Doval.Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget on July 23 in the Parliament, making significant announcements for Bihar and Andhra Pradesh.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleSummary: Rahul Gandhi likens penalty system to a "chakravyuh," an inescapable trap, designed to burden the average Indian citizen. Public sector banks collected around Rs 8,500 crore in penalties for not maintaining the average monthly minimum balance.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/scie.name: Twin meteor showers to peak within 24 hours; here's when & where to watch
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/scie.articleBody: Two meteor showers are all set to light up the night sky on July 30 and July 31 and one can watch up to 25 meteors per hour depending on their location, as per the American Meteor Society. The Alpha Capricornids and the Southern Delta Aquariids will peak simultaneously. "It's just an amazing coincidence," said Nicholas Moskovitz, a planetary astronomer at Lowell Observatory in Arizona, according to CNN.Having two meteor showers peak within 24 hours is "a little bit unusual," Moskovitz told Live Science. "But the idea of multiple showers being visible in a single night? Certainly not too uncommon."When and where to watchMeteor showers occur when Earth's orbit intersects a comet's path, causing the rocky debris left behind by the comet to burn up as it enters Earth's atmosphere. During this double meteor shower, Earth will cross the orbits of comet 96P/Machholz, causing the Southern Delta Aquariids to peak from July 29 to July 30, and comet 169P/NEAT, which creates the Alpha Capricornids peaking from July 30 to July 31.Wednesday night is the best time to view both showers, according to Robert Lunsford of the American Meteor Society. As the moon wanes, it loses about 8% illumination each night, which can hinder the visibility of fainter meteors. On Monday, the moon will be about 34% full, and on Wednesday it will be 16% full, according to Nasa's Daily Moon Guide. Best viewing conditionsThe double meteor shower will be best viewed in the Southern Hemisphere, where the radiant, or the apparent point from which the shower originates, will be almost overhead. However, people in the Northern Hemisphere can also see the meteor shower if they have a clear view of the southern horizon. Both meteor showers will continue until mid-August."Almost all meteor showers peak in the early morning hours between 2 and 4 am," Moskovitz said. "So if you want to catch either one of these, your best chances of seeing meteors are to get to a dark site and do so after midnight."Viewing tipsBoth showers are best viewed with the naked eye. For other skywatching events this year, a new pair of binoculars or a good backyard telescope might be useful.The science behind meteor showersMeteor showers occur at regular intervals due to their predictable orbits around the sun. The intensity of these showers can vary annually, influenced by when comets release debris and the duration the debris has been in space. Predicting meteor showers is crucial for the safety of spacecraft and humans traveling in space, said Moskovitz, who leads the Lowell Observatory Cameras for All-Sky Meteor Surveillance (LO-CAMS), a network of cameras monitoring meteors.Southern Delta Aquariids and Alpha CapricornidsAt its peak, the Southern Delta Aquariids will display around 20 to 25 meteors per hour, compared to "background" meteor showers that typically show around five meteors per hour. The Southern Delta Aquariids will appear "pretty faint," Moskovitz said. "You really need to get to a dark site, away from lights and traffic, stay off your cell phones, let your eyes acclimate to the dark, and you may have a chance of seeing some of those faint objects."In contrast, the Alpha Capricornids are less frequent but often produce "bright fireballs with bigger meteor chunks coming in, burning up, and getting brighter, making for a more spectacular show," Moskovitz explained. These bright meteors are composed of marble-sized particles, while the fainter meteors are usually grain-sized.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/scie.articleSummary: The Alpha Capricornids are less frequent but often produce bright fireballs. These bright meteors are composed of marble-sized particles. The fainter meteors usually are usually grain-sized. Two meteor showers are set to light up the night sky on July 30 and July 31. The Alpha Capricornids and the Southern Delta Aquariids will peak simultaneously. One can watch up to 25 meteors per hour depending on their location, as per the American Meteor Society.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.name: 'I don't dream like Mungerilal': Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh says BJP will not give him a chance now
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Former BJP MP from Kaiserganj and Wrestling Federation of India chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, facing sexual harassment allegations, said on Monday that he did not expect another ticket from his party.During his tour of his former parliamentary constituency in Gonda district, Brij Bhushan made a stop in Paraspur to meet the family members of murdered Samajwadi Party leader Om Prakash Singh. Answering reporters' questions in Paraspur, Brij Bhushan said, "The BJP will never give me a chance now. I know the party will not give me a chance. I don't dream like Mungerilal. Those who want to, can." Mungerilal is the lead character of âMungerilal ke haseen sapne,â a 1989 TV show, who was a daydreamer.Brij Bhushan is accused of sexually harassing several women wrestlers. Following a major controversy and a protracted protest by prominent wrestlers last year, he was removed from his position. Consequently, he was not allowed to contest in the Lok Sabha election. His son Karan Bhushan Singh, however, won the constituency previously held by his father on BJP ticket.The trial against him commenced last week, invoking charges under the Indian Penal Code related to sexual harassment, use of force against a woman, and criminal intimidation. The former MP has pleaded not guilty to these charges, maintaining his innocence.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.articleSummary: Brij Bhushan is accused of sexually harassing several women wrestlers. Following a major controversy and a protracted protest by prominent wrestlers, he was removed from his position. He was not allowed to contest in the Lok Sabha election.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: More trouble on cards for IAS officer Puja Khedkar as dept of personnel seeks response on allegations
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: PUNE: The Department of Personnel and Training (DoPT) has issued a show-cause notice to IAS trainee Puja Khedkar asking her to explain by Aug 2 her position on the various allegations against her."The show-cause was sent on July 26 by email as well as to her postal address, following inquiries by various agencies. Khedkar has been given seven days to respond to the notice," DoPT officials privy to the developments told TOI on Monday."The notice, issued as per procedure, seeks her response, which she has to either give in person by coming before the DoPT or send the same in writing," an official said.  Puja yet to report to Mussoorie academy: Officials  The official said it was up to Puja Khedkar how she would respond to the show cause. "We have sent the mail to her official email address as well as have sent the notice to her postal address. If she fails to respond within the deadline, further action will be considered," the official said.The central govt has constituted a single-member panel to verify Khedkar's candidature claims and other details based on a report filed by the Maharashtra govt. Khedkar, if found guilty of making wrongful claims, can face termination from service.Based on the Union Public Service Commission's complaint, the Delhi police's crime branch has already registered a case of cheating, fraud and forgery against Khedkar.Last week, the single member committee submitted its report to the DoPT secretary. A DoPT team is examining the findings of this report and will recommend the necessary action.DoPT officials said Khedkar was supposed to report to Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration in Mussoorie by July 23 after being relieved of her district training program from Washim in Maharashtra. However, officials from the academy confirmed on Monday that she was yet to report there.Pune's additional commissioner of police (Crime) Shailesh Balkawade told TOI, "The Delhi police crime branch has not contacted us for any help or seeking information in respect of the cheating and forgery case registered by the UPSC against IAS probationary officer Puja Khedkar."
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleSummary: The show-cause was sent on July 26 by email as well as to her postal address. Khedkar has been given seven days to respond to the notice. Delhi police's crime branch has already registered a case of cheating, fraud and forgery.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.name: 'I need to find a job to earn money': Manu Bhaker's coach Jaspal Rana reveals his struggles after Tokyo debacle
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleBody: NEW DELHI: Jaspal Rana, the coach of Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker, recently disclosed his ongoing struggle to secure a permanent job since the Tokyo Olympics. This revelation came after Bhaker's historic achievement of winning a bronze medal in Paris, making her the first female shooter from India to win an Olympic medal.In an emotional interview with RevSportz, Rana shared the hardships he has faced since Bhaker's unexpected exit from the Tokyo Games. He spoke about the criticism he received and the financial difficulties he has endured for the past three years. Live Updates: Paris Olympics Day 4"All those who abused me, made me a villain after Tokyo, when I was not even present there are now wanting interviews from me. No problem, I did interviews, but are these people going to make up for my losses in life at large?" Rana questioned, reflecting on the backlash he faced.Despite his happiness over Bhaker's Olympic success, Rana highlighted the lack of financial support from the National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) and other sporting organizations. He has not received any salary for the past three years, leaving him in a challenging financial situation.  112094670"I am nobody, I just did a job Manu wanted me to help her out with. But are people aware I have had no monthly salary from the National Rifle Association of India or any other agency over the last three years? I am more than happy Manu has shown what she can do, I only tapped into her potential. I need to go back to India and start afresh. I need to find a job to earn money," said Rana.Rana expressed his gratitude towards PT Usha and Captain Ajay Narang for their assistance in obtaining accreditation for the Olympics, but he acknowledged the numerous obstacles he encountered even after securing it.During the interview, Rana became emotional, expressing his sense of insignificance and financial hardship. "Manu is the star, I am just a jobless coach. I am nobody. Manu made me relevant by asking me to help her. I need to find a job soon, these three years have been very tough for me. I never wanted to talk about this. Anyone going to get me a job, I have to ask around when I get back to India," he stated.112089259
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/spor.articleSummary: Jaspal Rana, the coach of Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker, recently disclosed his ongoing struggle to secure a permanent job since the Tokyo Olympics. This revelation came after Bhaker's historic achievement of winning a bronze medal in Paris. Rana highlighted the lack of financial support from the National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) and other sporting organizations.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.name: ITR filing FY 2023-24 deadline extension: Will Income Tax Department extend the July 31, 2024 deadline for filing tax returns?
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleBody: ITR Filing FY 2023-24 deadline extension: The Income Tax Department has advised taxpayers to file their income tax returns for the financial year 2023-24 before the July 31, 2024 deadline.According to an ET report, the Income Tax Department has issued an alert to the public regarding erroneous information published in media about the extension of the ITR filing deadline. "The department has stated that this is false, and that the deadline for filing ITR for FY2023-24 is July 31, 2024." . Will ITR filing deadline for FY 2023-24 be extended?Going by the past record, it is highly unlikely that there will be an extension to the ITR filing deadline this year, as over 5 crore ITRs for AY 2024-25 have already been filed as of July 26th, compared to July 27th last year, the ET report said.. By July 31, 2023, 6.77 crore income tax returns (ITRs) were filed, and it is expected that the current figures will soon surpass the previous ones.Despite numerous technical issues on the e-filing portal, such as problems with Aadhaar-based OTP authentication, slow page loading, and upload errors, it is improbable that the deadline will be extended unless there is a significant technical issue on the website.Also Read | ITR Filing FY 2023-24: What happens if I file income tax return after deadline? Check penalties, consequences for late filingThe All-India Federation of Tax Practitioners (AIFTP) has urged the CBDT to extend the deadline for filing Income Tax returns for the assessment year 2024-25 by one month to August 31, citing the impact of floods and landslides on tax return filings in several states, as well as persistent issues with the Income Tax portal and software, and time-consuming processes for paying self-assessment tax.With just a couple of days left for this year's ITR filing last date, tax filers are still facing issues with the e-filing portal. The CBDT chairman has stated that they are closely engaging with their service providers Infosys, IBM, and Hitachi to address the issues, and has been assured that the website will function properly.110773928
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/busi.articleSummary: The Income Tax Department has advised taxpayers to file their income tax returns for the financial year 2023-24 before the July 31, 2024 deadline. The department has issued an alert to the public regarding erroneous information published in media about the extension of the ITR filing deadline.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.name: Morning bonhomie and a day of mixed signals in UP BJP
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.articleBody: LUCKNOW: After playing the face of 'defiance' within the UP BJP since the Lok Sabha poll debacle, Deputy chief ministers Keshav Prasad Maurya and Brijesh Pathak appeared on either side of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath as he chaired the BJP legislative party meeting held ahead of the State Assembly Monsoon Session on Monday.Both Maurya and Pathak have, until now, stayed away from quite a few key govt meetings that were presided over by the CM. Maurya had even skipped the Prayagraj division meeting of BJP MLAs convened by Yogi recently. On Monday, the two deputy CMs were not only seen sitting beside the CM for the first time after the Lok Sabha poll results but also shared the same frame when the CM was speaking to media persons in the morning.By the afternoon, however, it turned out to be a day of mixed political signals as Maurya, while speaking at the party's OBC Morcha event, reiterated his stand that 'it's the political party that wins elections and not any govt'.The CM reached the House about five minutes before the proceedings on the first day of the Monsoon session. Yogi went to the Opposition benches and exchanged greetings with the newly nominated Leader of Opposition in UP Vidhan Sabha, Mata Prasad Pandey, senior SP leaders Shivpal Yadav and others. The CM also met Raja Bhaiyya and his cabinet colleagues Om Prakash Rajbhar.Interestingly, several MLAs from the treasury benches touched Yogiâs feet to seek his blessings. Yogi was also seen interacting with the legislators in an informal manner and listening to them carefully. The picture-perfect moment that caught the attention of photographers and videographers was initially seen by observers as the cascading impact of the Delhi visit.However, barring one meeting of BJP organisation secretary BL Santosh and Yogi which became public, the CM and two deputy CMs' participation in BJP-ruled CMsâ meeting addressed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the CMâs participation in NITI Ayog meeting, no reports of any one-on-one or closed-door meetings between any leader connected to UP have come to the fore.The bonhomie later in the day looked like an opportunity to be on the politically right side as Maurya, during the OBC Morcha executive committee meet, again reiterated his earlier stand that the organisation was bigger than the govt. âIt is the political party which wins the elections and not any govt. Had that not been the case, the BJP would not have won the 2017 election despite there being no BJP govt in the state then,â he said. He, however, also toed the earlier line of the CM and said that overconfidence led to defeat on several seats.Later in the day, he posted on X about his meeting with top police officials as the leader of Vidhan Parishad and stated that the DGP had been instructed to ensure peopleâs problems are heard in police stations and there was a check on corruption.While addressing the BJP working committee meeting members on July 14, the deputy CM said that his pain and that of the party workers were the same.
